title: Pillsbury's Holiday Cookie Doughs Look So Good, We’re Buying Every Pack
description: Grab a pack for your annual cookie exchange party. READ MORE...
author: Ashia Aubourg
excerpt: Grab a pack for your annual cookie exchange party.

All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.Credit: Billy F Blume Jr/ShutterstockEven as an experienced baker with years of education and countless hours making cookies for my farmers market stand business, I still get excited whenever Pillsbury releases its holiday lineup in stores. Seeing the festive packages in the refrigerator aisle takes me back to my childhood when I would beg my mom to let me buy a roll of dough to create delicious treats at home.If you find joy in the release of Pillsbury’s annual holiday rollout, too, the good news is that the popular company just started sending its products to stores across the nation.According to @snackbetch, a popular outlet that shares the latest details about food launches and rollouts, if you head to most grocers, you’ll start to see all kinds of Pillsbury products hanging out on the shelves. The post calls out popular finds like the brand’s Snowman, Reindeer, The Grinch, Christmas Tree, and Elf sugar cookie dough, plus rolls of Gingerbread, Sugar, and Candy Cane “eat or bake” sliceable dough. While the prices vary depending on the pack, at Target, you can find boxes of Pillsbury’s ready-to-bake Christmas Tree sugar cookie dough for $4.89. Kroger sells a 30-ounce pack of the “eat or bake” sliceable Gingerbread cookie dough for $4.99.Obsessed fans raced to the comment section of the Instagram post detailing the drop. “They are so adorable. Hopefully, I can find some,” one person mentioned. Another shopper called out the likelihood of actually getting a pack, saying, “They’ll be gone from the shelves in two days.” Every year, Pillsbury quietly releases its holiday cookie lineup. However, due to the excitement surrounding these nostalgic treats, you may need to search a bit to find your favorite packs. With the holiday season underway, we recommend checking your grocery store on your next shopping trip to stock up on any cookie dough you find before it all sells out.Buy: Pillsbury Christmas Tree Sugar Cookies, $4.89
html:
• Groceries
  • Product Reviews & Recommendations

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

Even as an experienced baker with years of education and countless hours making cookies for my farmers market stand business, I still get excited whenever Pillsbury releases its holiday lineup in stores. Seeing the festive packages in the refrigerator aisle takes me back to my childhood when I would beg my mom to let me buy a roll of dough to create delicious treats at home.

If you find joy in the release of Pillsbury’s annual holiday rollout, too, the good news is that the popular company just started sending its products to stores across the nation.

According to @snackbetch, a popular outlet that shares the latest details about food launches and rollouts, if you head to most grocers, you’ll start to see all kinds of Pillsbury products hanging out on the shelves. The post calls out popular finds like the brand’s Snowman, Reindeer, The Grinch, Christmas Tree, and Elf sugar cookie dough, plus rolls of Gingerbread, Sugar, and Candy Cane “eat or bake” sliceable dough. 

While the prices vary depending on the pack, at Target, you can find boxes of Pillsbury’s ready-to-bake Christmas Tree sugar cookie dough for $4.89. Kroger sells a 30-ounce pack of the “eat or bake” sliceable Gingerbread cookie dough for $4.99.

Obsessed fans raced to the comment section of the Instagram post detailing the drop. “They are so adorable. Hopefully, I can find some,” one person mentioned. Another shopper called out the likelihood of actually getting a pack, saying, “They’ll be gone from the shelves in two days.” 

Every year, Pillsbury quietly releases its holiday cookie lineup. However, due to the excitement surrounding these nostalgic treats, you may need to search a bit to find your favorite packs. With the holiday season underway, we recommend checking your grocery store on your next shopping trip to stock up on any cookie dough you find before it all sells out.

Buy: Pillsbury Christmas Tree Sugar Cookies, $4.89
